general_advisory: Watch for rain before applying pesticides. If necessary spray only when the sky becomes clear and use a sticker to the spray solution. In fallow uplands, utilizing recent rainfall, farmers should take up short-duration low water-requiring crops like black gram, green gram, sesame, fodder crops, etc. Regular surveillance work should be taken up in all crops to know the incidence of various insect pests and initiate the control strategies. Due to high humidity, there are possibilities of pest and disease buildup in already sown crops. Take plant protection measures depending on the crop and weather conditions.

advisory: Current weather may favor blast disease in rice. To control it, spray Tebuconazole 50% + Trifloxystrobin 25% WG at 0.4 g/litre of water or Tricyclazole 45% + Hexaconazole 10% WG at 1 g/litre of water.
There is a chance of stem borer and leaf folder infestation. If found in the field, then spray Chlorantraniliprole 18.5% SC at 0.3 ml/litre of water or Flubendiamide 20% WG at 0.25 g/litre of water.
Develop a better drainage system to avoid waterlogging conditions due to excess rainfall.

There may be aphids incidence in maize due to high humidity and cloudy conditions if observed. Spray Thiamethoxam 12.6% + Lambda-cyhalothrin 9.5% ZC at 0.25 ml/litre of water or Imidacloprid 17.8% SL at 0.3 ml/litre of water on sunny days.
Fall armyworm may be observed in the field. To control it, spray Emamectin benzoate 5% SG at 0.4 g/litre of water or Chlorantraniliprole 18.5% SC at 0.4 ml/litre of water.

Prepare the field and raise Kharif groundnut of high-yielding varieties. Treat the seeds with Trichoderma viridae (10 gm.), Pseudomonas fluorescence (10 gm.), and Rhizobium culture (20 gm.) per kg of seed before sowing.

This is the time for sowing of pre-rabi Black gram (Biri) and Green gram (Mung). Use 10 kg seeds/acre. Before sowing, seeds are to be treated with Rhizobium culture. Apply 4 kg urea, 35 kg DAP, and 13 kg MOP per acre during final land preparation. Sow the seeds in a line of 30 cm apart with a 10-15 cm plant to plant distance.

This is the optimum time for sowing of pre-rabi sesame. Sow the seeds in lines of 30 cm apart and 10 cm between plants using 3 kg seed/acre. Apply 6.5 kg urea, 17 kg DAP, and 13 kg MoP per acre during final land preparation.
There is a chance of downy mildew attack in cucumber. If observed, spray Metalaxyl 8% + Mancozeb 64% at 2 g/litre of water on sunny days.

In upland well-drained soil complete the nursery sowing for tomato. Use high-yielding varieties at 150-200 g seed/acre. Use a low-cost polythene cover above the nursery to avoid the seedlings from excess rainfall.

Present climate is suitable for bacterial spot and speck of tomato. To manage at an early stage, go for organic treatment by submerging seeds for one minute in sodium hypochlorite or in hot water (50oC) for 25 minutes to reduce the incidence of both diseases.

If leaf curl and mosaic diseases are observed in the chilli field, to manage this disease, spray dimethoate 30 EC at 500 ml/ha or imidacloprid 17.8 SL at 100 ml/ha to control insect vectors and to destroy the infected plants immediately after noticing the initial symptoms. Repeat the spray 15 days later if necessary.
